Class Game

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--Game
All Implemented Interfaces:
Constants
public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
implements Constants

This class is used for simulating a game between two Players. It implements a proper protocol for the game, and stores the outcomes.

Note that this class is still not complete. If it so happens that a particular player program enters into an infinite loop or recursion - then it will not be terminated, even after its time limit is exceeded. However, it is sifficient for programmers to test thier own players using this class. Rest of the work will be done by the time of the contest.

Method Detail

simulateGame

public void simulateGame()
Simulates the game between the two players

getWinner

public int getWinner()
This method is used to get the result of the ame

Returns:
WHITE if white wins, BLACK if black wins, NONE if the game ends in a draw, time out or exception thrown by one of the players' programs.

getPlayer1Time

public long getPlayer1Time()
Get the CPU time taken by player 1

Returns:
the CPU time taken by player 1 in milliseconds

getPlayer2Time

public long getPlayer2Time()
Get the CPU time taken by player 2

Returns:
the CPU time taken by player 2 in milliseconds

hasPlayer1Erred

public boolean hasPlayer1Erred()
Returns whether player 1 erred in the game. An error can be any of the following : An exception, an invalid move or exceeding time limit

Returns:
true if player 1 erred, false otherwise

hasPlayer2Erred

public boolean hasPlayer2Erred()
Returns whether player 2 erred in the game. An error can be any of the following : An exception, an invalid move or exceeding time limit

Returns:
true if player 2 erred, false otherwise

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
This can be used for testing your own player. You can specify your own player by typing the class name on the command prompt. e.g. If you want to test your player against RandomPlayer, where MyPlayer is your player class, type "java MyPlayer RandomPlayer" on the command prompt.

Parameters:
args - The arguments - i.e. The player class names. If args are missing, default arguments will be used.
